thread.title: After 7 years, heartless owner returns 'Bettie' to same high kill shelter
thread.title_full: After 7 years, heartless owner returns 'Bettie' to same high kill shelter | Examiner.com

author: Cheryl Hanna
title: After 7 years, heartless owner returns 'Bettie' to same high kill shelter
text:
Help Bettie find a home; this is her "last call." Pet Harbor Seven years ago, Bettie, a very petite Labrador retriever mix puppy was adopted from the Miami-Dade Animal Services. This sweet dog thought she had a "forever" home, even though her family paid little attention to her and kept her chained up outdoors for most of her life. They named her "Black Girl", and although life wasn't perfect, she still had a safe home where she was properly fed.
For an unknown reason, just a few weeks ago, Black Girl was no longer wanted. The dog's former owner just decided she didn't want her dog, leashed her up and brought her back to Miami-Dade Animal Services; knowing that the shelter was overcrowded and her dog's future would be in dire jeopardy. With a flick of the leash turned over to the staff at the shelter, Bettie was discarded. Sadly, Bettie never did anything wrong; she never showed any aggressive behavior, she never ran away, and she always wagged her tail in spite of mostly having been ignored.
Click here for Bettie's PetHarbor listing. BETTIE - ID#A1144943 " I am a spayed female, black and white Labrador Retriever mix. The shelter staff think I am about 7 years old. I have been at the shelter since Sep 17, 2015. For more information about this animal, call Miami-Dade Animal Services at (305) 884-1101." A Facebook page for Bettie can be found here. Please share Bettie's plight with friends, family and social media contacts. Her time is nearly up, and no one has come forward to help. This 35-pound girl is described as a wonderful and gentle dog. Won't you give her a chance to become your best friend? Miami Dade Animal Services is located at 7401 NW 74th St, Miami, ‪Florida‬ 33166.
Follow the National Pet Rescue Examiner on Facebook.
